intro: Trevoa tenuis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved trevoa, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae, which includes many plants adapted to nutrient-poor soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Trevoa tenuis is often found in coastal and sandy habitats, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
